title: Hildeberto Pereira
text:
Hildeberto José Morgado Pereira (born 2 March 1996) is a professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="China%20League%20One">China League One</a> club <a href="Kunshan%20F.C.">Kunshan</a> as either a <a href="Midfielder">winger</a> or a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">right back</a>. Born in Portugal, Pereira represents the <a href="Cape%20Verde%20national%20football%20team">Cape Verde national football team</a>.
Club career.
Benfica.
A product of <a href="S.L.%20Benfica">S.L. Benfica</a>'s youth system, Pereira debuted for <a href="S.L.%20Benfica%20B">Benfica B</a> on 15 March 2015 in a 3–0 away win at <a href="S.C.%20Farense">Farense</a> (0–3) in the <a href="Segunda%20Liga">Segunda Liga</a>. He netted a brace in a victory by the same score at <a href="FC%20Porto%20B">Porto B</a> on 17 May.
On 22 July 2016, Pereira signed a season-long loan deal with English <a href="EFL%20Championship">Championship</a> club <a href="Nottingham%20Forest%20F.C.">Nottingham Forest</a> for the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Nottingham%20Forest%20F.C.%20season">2016–17 season</a>. He scored his first goal for the club in a 3–1 win over <a href="Birmingham%20City%20F.C.">Birmingham City</a> on 14 October. Pereira was sent off on 7 November during a 1–1 draw with <a href="Queens%20Park%20Rangers%20F.C.">Queens Park Rangers</a>, which was already his third dismissal of the season following earlier red cards away at <a href="Aston%20Villa%20F.C.">Aston Villa</a> on 11 September and at <a href="Blackburn%20Rovers%20F.C.">Blackburn Rovers</a> on 18 October. Forest manager <a href="Philippe%20Montanier">Philippe Montanier</a>, was angry that his first caution was collected for dissent and confirmed that the player would be fined by the club.
When <a href="Mark%20Warburton">Mark Warburton</a> was appointed as Forest manager in March 2017 for the last nine games of the season, Pereira took no further part in the campaign.
Legia Warsaw.
On 10 July 2017, Pereira joined <a href="Ekstraklasa">Ekstraklasa</a> side <a href="Legia%20Warsaw">Legia Warsaw</a> on a four-contract with the option of a fifth. He played seven games during his time in the <a href="Warsaw">Polish capital</a>, and scored twice on 28 November in a 4–2 home win (7–3 aggregate) over <a href="Bytovia%20Byt%C3%B3w">Bytovia Bytów</a> in the quarter-finals of the <a href="Polish%20Cup">cup</a>. 
Pereira returned to the <a href="English%20Football%20League">English Football League</a> on 3 January 2018, joining <a href="Northampton%20Town%20F.C.">Northampton Town</a> in <a href="EFL%20League%20One">League One</a> until the end of the season. On 13 February, as a half-time substitute for <a href="Sam%20Foley">Sam Foley</a>, he was sent off in a 2–1 home loss to <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">Gillingham</a>.
Pereira arrived at Legia overweight because of three months without playing, and suffered an injury that ruled him out for a further three. He considered quitting football as a result.
Vitória de Setúbal.
On 2 August 2018, Pereira returned to Portugal and signed a three-year contract with Primeira Liga side <a href="Vit%C3%B3ria%20F.C.">Vitória de Setúbal</a>. He scored four times in his first top-flight season, including a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> on 6 October in a 4–0 home win against <a href="Moreirense%20F.C.">Moreirense FC</a>.
Kunshan F.C..
On 6 September 2020, Pereira joined <a href="China%20League%20One">China League One</a> side <a href="Kunshan%20F.C.">Kunshan</a>.
International career.
Born in Portugal, Pereira is of Cape Verdean descent. He debuted for the <a href="Cape%20Verde%20national%20football%20team">Cape Verde national football team</a> in a friendly 2–1 win over <a href="Togo%20national%20football%20team">Togo</a> on 10 October 2019.
Honours.
Benfica
